data.title: Leona Lewis gives birth, welcomes first baby with husband Dennis Jauch
data.meta_description: "Bleeding Love" singer Leona Lewis and her husband, Dennis Jauch, welcomed their first child. The couple announced their pregnancy news in March.
data.text:
Leona Lewisâ€™ little one has arrived.

The â€œBleeding Loveâ€ singer, 37, gave birth on July 22 to her and husband Dennis Jauchâ€™s first baby.

â€œAnd then there were three ğŸ’—Our little Carmel Allegra arrived 22.7.22 ğŸ•Š,â€ she captioned a photo of the family holding their baby girl.

The â€œX Factorâ€ winner had hinted at her due date while announcing her pregnancy in March.

â€œCanâ€™t wait to meet you in the Summer â¤ï¸,â€ Lewis captioned her baby bump debut on Instagram at the time.

Jauch, 33, celebrated the news with the same snap, writing, â€œBiggest gift I couldâ€™ve asked for coming this Summer â¤ï¸ Youâ€™re one hot a** Mama @leonalewis.â€

The couple wed in July 2019 in Italy.

â€œI will cherish this day for a lifetime,â€ the bride wrote via Instagram the following month. â€œNine years ago this amazing man walked into my life and last weekend we said â€˜I doâ€™ surrounded by the people we love.

â€œFrom our family style dinner in the vineyards of Tuscany to our ceremony in the small chapel that sheltered us from the storm outside, to the all night singing & dance party, every moment was a gift of love,â€ she continued.

In November of the following year, Lewis told the Telegraph that they were considering starting a family via adoption.

â€œI do want children â€¦ but Iâ€™m still figuring things out,â€ the England native said in the 2020 interview. â€œIf it was up to my husband, we would have had kids yesterday.â€

When Lewis did conceive in 2021, she became â€œseverely ill and unable to leave the houseâ€ due to a â€œchallengingâ€ first trimester.

She gave a glimpse of her â€œhealingâ€ journey in a March Instagram video, encouraging others to â€œspend time in nature.â€

The â€œBetter in Timeâ€ songstress elaborated on her pregnancy struggles in May.

â€œAt the end of last year I found out I was pregnant whilst being on tour which was the best news ever as honestly I didnâ€™t even know if I would be able to be a mum,â€ she wrote at the time. â€œItâ€™s been quite a journey.â€

Lewis added that despite â€œsuffering horrendous sicknessâ€ on tour, her goal was always to give her fans â€œthe show and attention [they] deserve.â€
